repository.label: Repository

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Carlton "Butch" Foust was an advertising executive who worked for J. Walter Thompson, Benton & Bowles, McCann-Erickson and other agencies, often in Latin America and Spain. Collection spans the years 1959-2003 and contains advertising and market research files, client files, brochures, tear sheets, annual reports, case histories, videocassettes, and other files documenting Foust's career as an advertising executive primarily in Latin America and Spain. Materials chiefly relate to Foust's work on behalf of clients such as Kraft Foods, Kellogg, Proctor & Gamble, Coca-Cola, and Unilever, as well as numerous alcoholic beverage companies. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

note.label: Language of Materials
note.p: Language: Material in English Spanish Italian

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original audiovisual materials are closed to research until use copies can be produced. Contact Research SErvices for more information.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Carlton Foust Papers, John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Carlton Foust Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2008-0100

scopecontent.head: Collection overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans the years 1959-2003 and contains advertising and market research files, client files, brochures, tear sheets, annual reports, case histories, videocassettes, and other files documenting Foust's career as an advertising executive primarily in Latin America and Spain. Materials chiefly relate to Foust's work on behalf of clients such as Kraft Foods, Kellogg, Proctor & Gamble, Coca-Cola, and Unilever, as well as numerous alcoholic beverage companies. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically into seven series: General Files; Account Files; Advertisements; New Business Files; Printed Material; Oversize Material; and Audiovisual Materials.

did.unittitle: Presentation: On Beyond Bite and Smile, undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes planning documents, research reports, brand guidelines, correspondence and other materials relating to the management of advertising account campaigns. Agencies represented include Benton & Bowles (B&B), J. Walter Thompson (JWT), and McCann-Erickson and their various offices and partnerships primarily in Spain, Germany and Latin America. Companies include Kellogg's, Kraft, and Procter & Gamble. Arranged alphabetically by office and client name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily a clipping file of print advertisements and printed literature for a range of alcoholic beverages. Whiskey and especially Scotch are heavily represented. Arranged alphabetically by beverage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes new business pitch presentations, background research and correspondence relating to agency efforts to acquire new advertising accounts. Arranged by agency office and company name.
